pr_title: Do reverse-connection check of new game hosts when posting games

timeline.message:
Do reverse-connection check of new game hosts when posting games

This update combines the connectivity check endpoint with the post-game
endpoint. This avoids any timing issues and seeks to simplify
the game posting flow. Instead of a client doing two round trips
to the server to first post a game and then ask for a connectivity
check, it is done as one now.

For implementation updates, we update the response from the game-posting
request to include both game-id (nullable) and the result of the
connectivity check. After posting a game we now should check
the connectivity result and if okay, then proceed, otherwise
execute the previous behavior when the connectivity check failed
(which is to show the "this is how to set up port forwarding" message
and shutdown).

replies.bodyText: Good question, this is something to update. We no longer have a 'how to host' menu option. The reason it was removed is that the game was linking to many forum posts, some/many of which were getting out of date. Instead of having that type of situation, instead all help content should be linked to the user guide and then we maintain just one link to the user guide.
